results.name: Triangle T(n,k) = (-1)^(k+1) if n is odd, = (-1)^k if n and k are even, = 2*(-1)^k if n is even and k is odd, 0<=k<=n.
comment: Original definition: A pattern triangular array with three coefficient states:{-2,-1,1} Rules: States {1,-1} going to States{1,-2,1} States{1,-2} going to {1,-1,1} States{-2,1} going to {-1,1,-1}.
The unsigned version is given by T(n,k)= 1 + mod(n-k,2) *mod(k,2). - _Roger L. Bagula_, Sep 06 2008
The row sums of the absolulte values are 1, 2, 4, 4, 7, 6, 10, 8, 13, 10, 16, ... - _Roger L. Bagula_, Sep 06 2008
The row sums of the absolute values are 1+n*(5+(-1)^n)/4 = 1+A080512(n). - _R. J. Mathar_, May 12 2013
mathematica: For the unsigned version: t[n_, m_] = 1 + Mod[n - m, 2]*Mod[m, 2]; Table[Table[t[n, m], {m, 0, n}], {n, 0, 10}]; Flatten[%] - _Roger L. Bagula_, Sep 06 2008
